What's the word on 0.90 compatibility?

In 0.90, it's like this. NOTE: The very minor issues noted below might have been pre-existing---I never bothered to test them before.

  • The lights load in the game with no problem
  • The lights turn on and off with the light button stock action group no problem
  • Their colors can be adjusted no problem
  • For the directional spotlight, the rotation keys Q & E rotate the light as the A & D keys do on all other parts, and vice versa. IOW, you stick the light on the side of a rocket and it's pointing down. You want it to point right. With any other part (say a Sepratron), you'd hit D for this. But with this light, you need to hit E.
  • The 4-way light has separate right-click buttons and action group actions to turn each separate light on and off individually. However, the first 3 of these buttons/actions don't work, and the 4th turns all 4 lights on and off together, so this light is really all or nothing, just like any other light. However, you can still change the colors for each light separately.

So, for the most part, this mod works just fine in 0.90. The spotlight rotation isn't really an issue---you can still rotate it any which way, you just use different keys than with other parts to do the same thing. The only really broken thing is the lack of individual switches for the 4-way light.

As ever, part mods that don't require plugins are extremely resilient to KSP version changes (don't quote me on this, but I'd surprised if an update broke them from now until final release). The last KSP version to break parts was, I think, 0.15. Unless Squad change the way parts are made and loaded etc, any part mod is likely to never need an update.
